item.title: Anthropic and Decision-Theoretical Dutch Books
item.description: Introduction # Here’s a fun factâ€”some combinations of anthropic assumptions and decision theories expose you to Dutch books.(1) (1)My apologies to readers who aren’t familiar with the basics of the anthropics and decision theory debates; I won’t be explaining them here. For an introduction to causal and evidential decision theory, I recommend chapter nine of Martin Peterson’s textbook, and for a (dated) intro to anthropics, I recommend Nick Bostrom’s Anthropic Bias.
